Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of the Dor Procedure with Intraoperative Substrate Mapping for Refractory Ventricular Tachycardia

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either the Dor procedure with intraoperative substrate mapping and ablation or standard care.

Participants.evidence: Conducted at a tertiary care center, this randomised controlled trial included patients with drug-resistant recurrent VT and LV aneurysms.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either the Dor procedure with intraoperative substrate mapping and ablation or standard care.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was VT recurrence, evaluated over a 28-month follow-up period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Due to the nature of the intervention, blinding was not feasible.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Two participants were randomised, with one in each group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Both participants were analysed per protocol.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The intervention group demonstrated no VT recurrence at 28 months, while the control group experienced VT recurrence.
